did.unittitle: John Teachout phonograph record collection 1950-1964 undated

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Alice Teachout (donor no. 10283) and came to the library in 2009.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Alice Teachout transferred her copyright to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, John Teachout phonograph record collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: John Teachout was an Ann Arbor, Michigan record producer. The name of his company was Idiom Recording.

scopecontent.p: The John Teachout collection consists of phonograph records produced by his Idiom Recording Company. Several of the records are of local Ann Arbor or University of Michigan performances. In addition to music, some of the records are of dramatic readings. A few of the identifications are uncertain as they were taken from hand-written labels.
